Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'require_secure_transport' setting is not enabled, which may allow unencrypted connections.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set 'require_secure_transport' to 'ON' and ensure SSL is enabled ('have_ssl' is 'YES').
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'require_secure_transport';" | grep -q 'ON' && mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'have_ssl';" | grep -q 'YES' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: SSL is not required for remote users, which may allow unencrypted connections.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure 'ssl_type' is set to 'ANY', 'X509', or 'SPECIFIED' for all remote users.
Rule.Correction: mysql -u root -p -e "UPDATE mysql.user SET ssl_type='ANY' WHERE host!='localhost'; FLUSH PRIVILEGES;"
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SELECT user,host,ssl_type FROM mysql.user WHERE host!='localhost' AND ssl_type NOT IN ('ANY', 'X509', 'SPECIFIED');" | grep -q . && echo 1 || echo 0

Rule.NonCompliantComment: No connection limits are set, which may allow resource exhaustion (DoS).
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set maximum connection limits for the server and per user.
Rule.Correction: sed -i '/\[mysqld\]/a max_connections=200; max_user_connections=20' /etc/mysql/my.cnf; systemctl restart mariadb
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'max_connections';" | grep -q '200' && mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'max_user_connections';" | grep -q '20' && echo 0 || echo 1
